steps.title: Swipe in from the right side of your Windows 8 device to access the “Start” screen.
steps.content: Swipe in from the right side of your Windows 8 device to access the “Start” screen. If you’re using a mouse, point to the lower left corner of your session to access the “Start” screen.

steps.title: Type “Control Panel” into the search field and select the option after it displays in the search results.
steps.content: Type “Control Panel” into the search field and select the option after it displays in the search results.

steps.title: Click on “View network status and tasks” below the Network and Internet section.
steps.content: Click on “View network status and tasks” below the Network and Internet section. A list of all your active networks will display.

steps.title: Click on the link displayed to the right of “Connections” for the network you’d like to check DNS settings for.
steps.content: Click on the link displayed to the right of “Connections” for the network you’d like to check DNS settings for. A network status window will display.

steps.title: Click on the “Properties” button within the status window.
steps.content: Click on the “Properties” button within the status window.

steps.title: Click on “Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP / IPv4).
steps.content: Click on “Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP / IPv4). ”

steps.title: Click on “Properties.
steps.content: Click on “Properties. ” Your computer’s current DNS settings will be located in the bottom half of the Properties window. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the “Start” button and select “Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on the “Start” button and select “Control Panel. ”

steps.title: Type “Network and Sharing” into the search field at the upper right corner of the Control Panel window.
steps.content: Type “Network and Sharing” into the search field at the upper right corner of the Control Panel window.

steps.title: Select “Network and Sharing Center” when it displays in the search results.
steps.content: Select “Network and Sharing Center” when it displays in the search results.

steps.title: Click on “Change adapter settings” in the left pane after the Network and Sharing Center window opens.
steps.content: Click on “Change adapter settings” in the left pane after the Network and Sharing Center window opens.

steps.title: Right-click on the network for which you want to check DNS settings.
steps.content: Right-click on the network for which you want to check DNS settings.

steps.title: Select “Properties” from the list of options provided.
steps.content: Select “Properties” from the list of options provided.

steps.title: Click on “Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP / IPv4).
steps.content: Click on “Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP / IPv4). ”

steps.title: Click on the “Properties” button.
steps.content: Click on the “Properties” button. Your DNS settings will display in the bottom portion of the window next to the DNS server fields.

steps.title: Click on the “Start” button on your Windows XP desktop.
steps.content: Click on the “Start” button on your Windows XP desktop.

steps.title: Select “Control Panel.
steps.content: Select “Control Panel. ”

steps.title: Select “Network Connections.
steps.content: Select “Network Connections. ” The Network Connections window will open.

steps.title: Right-click on “Local Area Connection” and select “Properties.
steps.content: Right-click on “Local Area Connection” and select “Properties. ” If you are connected to a Wi-Fi network, right-click on “Wireless Network Connection” and select “Properties.”

steps.title: Click on “Internet Protocol (TCP / IP).
steps.content: Click on “Internet Protocol (TCP / IP). ”

steps.title: Click on the “Properties” button.
steps.content: Click on the “Properties” button. Your computer’s DNS settings will be displayed at the bottom of the Properties window next to the DNS server fields.

steps.title: Click on the Apple icon at the top of your Mac desktop.
steps.content: Click on the Apple icon at the top of your Mac desktop.

steps.title: Select “System Preferences.
steps.content: Select “System Preferences. ”

steps.title: Click on the Network icon within System Preferences.
steps.content: Click on the Network icon within System Preferences.

steps.title: Click on the network for which you want to check DNS settings in the left pane of the Network window.
steps.content: Click on the network for which you want to check DNS settings in the left pane of the Network window.

steps.title: Click on the button labeled “Advanced.
steps.content: Click on the button labeled “Advanced. ”

steps.title: Click on the “DNS” tab.
steps.content: Click on the “DNS” tab. Your computer’s current DNS settings will display under the fields labeled “DNS servers” and “Search domains.”

steps.title: Click on the Network icon at the top left corner of your Ubuntu desktop.
steps.content: Click on the Network icon at the top left corner of your Ubuntu desktop. The Network icon will either resemble two arrows or a Wi-Fi symbol.

steps.title: Click on “Edit Connections.
steps.content: Click on “Edit Connections. ” The Network Connections window will display.

steps.title: Click on the name of the network connection for which you’d like to check DNS settings.
steps.content: Click on the name of the network connection for which you’d like to check DNS settings.

steps.title: Click on the “Edit” button in the right pane of Network Connections.
steps.content: Click on the “Edit” button in the right pane of Network Connections.

steps.title: Click on the tab labeled “IPv4 Settings.
steps.content: Click on the tab labeled “IPv4 Settings. ”

steps.title: Note the information posted in the field next to “DNS Servers.
steps.content: Note the information posted in the field next to “DNS Servers. ” These are your computer’s current DNS settings.

steps.title: Click on the small arrow in the upper right corner of your Fedora taskbar.
steps.content: Click on the small arrow in the upper right corner of your Fedora taskbar.

steps.title: Click on the Setting icon.
steps.content: Click on the Setting icon.

steps.title: Click on "Network" icon.
steps.content: Click on "Network" icon. The Network Connections window will display onscreen.

steps.title: Select the name of the network you’d like to check the DNS settings for.
steps.content: Select the name of the network you’d like to check the DNS settings for.

steps.title: Your computer’s current DNS settings will display under "Default Route".
steps.content: Your computer’s current DNS settings will display under "Default Route".
